summaries.novice: Understand why behavior reduction plans exist and the RBT’s role in implementation.
summaries.standard: Learn core components of behavior reduction, including replacement behaviors and extinction.
summaries.expert: Apply function-based behavior reduction strategies ethically and effectively.

novice.title: What Is a Behavior Reduction Plan?
content: A Behavior Reduction Plan is designed to decrease challenging behavior.
Plans are developed by qualified supervisors.
They focus on safety, dignity, and skill development.
RBTs follow plans exactly as written.

novice.title: When Behavior Reduction Is Appropriate
content: Reduction is used for dangerous or disruptive behavior.
Minor behaviors are often addressed through teaching.
Social significance is always considered.
Ethical principles guide all decisions.

novice.title: Role of the RBT
content: RBTs implement interventions as written.
They collect accurate, objective data.
They do not design or modify plans.
Concerns are reported to supervisors.

standard.title: Functions of Problem Behavior
content: Problem behavior serves a function.
Common functions include escape, attention, tangibles, and sensory.
Interventions must match the behavior’s function.
Changing form without changing function is ineffective.

standard.title: Replacement Behaviors
content: Replacement behaviors serve the same function as problem behavior.
They must be appropriate and efficient.
Teaching replacement skills reduces problem behavior.
Reinforcement strengthens new behaviors.

standard.title: Extinction
content: Extinction means withholding reinforcement for problem behavior.
Extinction often causes an initial increase in behavior.
Consistency is critical for effectiveness.
Supervisors guide extinction procedures.

expert.title: Differential Reinforcement
content: Differential reinforcement strengthens appropriate behavior.
Examples include DRA, DRI, DRO, and DRL.
Reinforcement is provided for desired responses.
Problem behavior is not reinforced.

expert.title: Ethical & Safety Considerations
content: Safety procedures must be followed exactly.
Least restrictive interventions are preferred.
Client dignity must be preserved at all times.
Ethics guide all behavior reduction strategies.

expert.title: Evaluating Plan Effectiveness
content: Data determines whether a plan is effective.
Lack of progress requires supervisor review.
Inconsistent implementation affects outcomes.
Ethical practice requires data-based decisions.

novice.question: What is the goal of a Behavior Reduction Plan?
novice.answer: To decrease challenging behavior safely and ethically.

expert.question: Problem behavior maintained by attention. What strategy?
expert.answer: Use differential reinforcement of appropriate attention-seeking.
expert.explanation: Reinforce appropriate behavior while withholding reinforcement for problem behavior.
